Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[NuGet.org Bug]: [Admin UI] Show number of package versions that have been selected in the Admin Unlist UI" (#9517) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Impact

It's more difficult to complete my work

### Describe the bug

When we have to unlist many package versions at once, we often need to break it up into smaller batches. Showing the number of package versions that have been selected in the bulk unlist UI would help me do a better job of batch-sizing.
![image](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/assets/82980589/2aacb376-6d0d-44c0-bc21-c5d442bcf831)

We could even add the ability to select the first 'X' <unlisted/listed> package versions to help with this.

### Repro Steps

1. Go to the Bulk Unlist UI in the Admin Panel
2. Enter names of packages you need to unlist
3. Scroll down

### Expected Behavior

1. Show how many package versions have been selected (possibly in the button text)
![image](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/assets/82980589/2aacb376-6d0d-44c0-bc21-c5d442bcf831)

2. Add the ability to select the first 'X' <unlisted/listed> package versions among those shown.

### Screenshots

_No response_

### Additional Context and logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[2FA] Avoid new accounts coming to the Register page." (#9501) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
# Changes
* Add `noindex` for `Register` (signup) and `SignInNugetAccount` (LogOnNuGetAccount) to avoid displaying them on search engines
* `SignUp` (/users/account/signup) page now redirects to `Sign In`.
* `LegacyRegister` (/account/register) page now redirects to `Sign In`.
* `Register` POST endpoint redirects to `Sign In` when it has a password registration and 2FA enforcement flag is turned.

Addresses https://github.com/NuGet/Engineering/issues/4768

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Remove unused 'OrganizationsEnabledForAll' file in blob storage" (#9516) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
'OrganizationsEnabledForAll' property was removed  5 years ago.
https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/pull/5822/files

However, this property is still in Login-Discontinuation-Configuration.json, it throws exceptions when initialization loginconfiguration.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[ReleasePrep][2023.05.23]RI of dev into main" (#9515) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Merged pull request "Adjust deprecation API slightly to prepare for public preview" (#9506) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
- No-op the last edit update if there are no changes (reduces V3 load)
- Require user agent and include the full UA as a custom dimension in App Insights
- Return 400 not 404 when the alternate package is missing 
- Require user agent for the deprecation endpoint
- These changes are backwards compatible with the known integrations with the Deprecation API

Depends on https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/pull/9505.

Align the API with the design changes described here: https://github.com/NuGet/Engineering/pull/4709 (internal PR now, will be public after public preview begins).

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "NuGet should use a different property for the platform version for C++/CLI" (#12521) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
The idea is that the property is used by NuGet for compatibility checks, instead of the version in the TargetPlatformMoniker as that already has a different meaning for C++/CLI projects. Note that we have something similar for UAP projects.

WIP property is `WindowsTargetPlatformMinVersion`.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "New prebuilt package in .NET source-build: microsoft.visualstudioeng.microbuild.core.1.0.0.nupkg" (#12603) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
New prebuilt package was introduced by `nuget/nuget.client`  repo, in latest flow to `installer`: https://github.com/dotnet/installer/pull/16391

```
microsoft.visualstudioeng.microbuild.core.1.0.0.nupkg
```

This needs to be fixed asap.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Feature]: add command dotnet config set" (#12476) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product(s) Involved

NuGet.exe, dotnet.exe

### The Elevator Pitch

Feature for #12469  
This command will set the value of a specified NuGet configuration setting, following [this spec](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/blob/dev/proposed/2022/dotnet-nuget-config-spec.md#set).

### Additional Context and Details

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Moving to the new .NET Foundation CLA service" (#68) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
Hello everyone
The .NET Foundation is transitioning to a new CLA service and I'm posting here to let you know it's happening. Some background info:

The new CLA service is based off of https://github.com/microsoft/ContributorLicenseAgreement, except it uses the dotnet-policy-service app

- Current contributors do not need to sign the CLA again
- The CLA agreement itself is not changing
- As part of the install/configuration process, the following work items will be completed

1. Create a .github repo if it doesn't exist already
2. Install the dotnet-policy-service app
3. Create PRs for the platformcontext.xml and cla.yml files
4. Disable the existing CLA webhook
5. Push the PRs to enable the new CLA service

That's all there is to it. I'll update this issue once the work is complete

Thanks
Chris
.NET Foundation Operations team

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Moving to the new .NET Foundation CLA service" (#68) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
Hello everyone
The .NET Foundation is transitioning to a new CLA service and I'm posting here to let you know it's happening. Some background info:

The new CLA service is based off of https://github.com/microsoft/ContributorLicenseAgreement, except it uses the dotnet-policy-service app

- Current contributors do not need to sign the CLA again
- The CLA agreement itself is not changing

4. Disable the existing CLA webhook
5. Push the PRs to enable the new CLA service

That's all there is to it. I'll update this issue once the work is complete
